intro: Tragopogon stepposus, commonly known as the steppe goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the steppes of Eastern Europe and Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant produces numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Tragopogon stepposus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
